description.en:
A collection of one-shot published by Gotouge during their rookie years:
- **Kagarigari** (Contest; 2013)
A town is thrown into disarray by a mass murderer. The culprit? A vampire…  
Then one day, a young man wielding a katana appears before the killer vampire!
- **Monjuroshi Kyoudai** (Jump Next!; 2015)
- **Rokkotsu-san** (Weekly Shonen Jump; 2014)
- **Haeniwa no Zigzag** (Weekly Shonen Jump; 2015):
He possesses a mysterious power. His job is to remove curses from others. Whenever abnormal situations arises, Zigzag is called to work. He accepts, however, it's not out of goodwill? A story about a hero? Definitely not this person.
description.ru:
Город встревожен страшным инцидентом. Совершено нападение на человека. Преступником оказался вампир… Что за парень осмелился направить свой меч против него?!  
  
The predecessor to [Kimetsu no Yaiba](https://mangadex.org/title/18198), won an honorable mention in the 70th Jump Treasure Rookie Manga Award.  
**Links:** [Offical Raws](http://jumpbookstore.com/client_info/SHUEISHA/html/player/viewer.html?tw=2&lin=1&cid=SHSA_ST01MOL013114001_57)  
  
- Monju Shirou Kyoudai (文殊史郎兄弟, 2014)  
  
- Rokkotsu-san (肋骨さん, 2014)  
  
- Haeniwa no Zigzag (蠅庭のジグザグ, 2015)  
He possesses a mysterious power. His job is to remove curses from others. Whenever an abnormal situations arises, Zigzag is called to work. He accepts, but it's not out of goodwill. A story about a hero? Definitely not this person!

biography.en:
**Associated Names**
Готогэ Коёхару
吾峠呼世晴

- Debuted with the oneshot Kagarigari in 2013 in a Shueisha's contest dedicated to newcomer, winning a honorable mention.
- Participated in the Weekly Shonen Jump's Gold Future Cup contest dedicated to rookie in 2014 with the oneshot Rokkotsu-san.
- Published other two oneshot in 2015, Haeniwa no Zigzag in Weekly Shonen Jump and Monjushirou Kyoudai in Jump Next!.
- Had first serialization in 2016 with Kimetsu no Yaiba (based very loosely on Kagarigari).

**Associated Names**

- Published other two oneshot in 2015, Haeniwa no Zigzag in Weekly Shonen Jump and Monjushirou Kyoudai in Jump Next!.
- Had first serialization in 2016 with Kimetsu no Yaiba (based very loosely on Kagarigari).
